content: pattern end the foot after an even-numbered row if the final row is 4 6 8 or 10 invert the colours of that final row if you added or removed pattern repeats you ll have to chart your own toe decreases i recommend first doing decreases in just the larger block s and then decreasing everything in sync for the first half of the decreases you want to average two pairs decreased per row for the second half of the decreases you want to average four pairs decreased per row until the final row decreases will happen twice per intarsia block meaning there will be 6 decreases per decrease row for the first half of thedecreases thismeansdecreaserowsshouldhappeneverythirdrow ifyouhaveunevenly-sizedintarsiablocks youmight start with 2 or 4 decreases per decrease row in which case they should be every row or every other row for the second half of the decreases all the blocks should be the same size so 2 out of every 3 row should be decrease row to place the decreases find a 3-and-3 group of pairs of stitches as close to the end of the intarsia block as you can get it and decrease to remove those columns of stitches sixy helix 4 ©2022 pi fisher 4 pattern description picking colours the colour groups will be a/b c/d and e/f colours a and b will not be used in the heel though it s possible to change your mind right before beginning the heel cuff using the smaller needles cast on 18 pairs of stitches 36 total stitches alternating between colours b and a the first stitch should be colour b and the last stitch should be colour a then cast on 18 pairs of stitches with colours d and c then cast on 18 pairs of stitches in colours f and e you ll have 3 separated blocks of stitches on your needles to prevent the yarns from unravelling while you work with the next group of colours you may find it helpful to tie a quick slipknot with the working ends after the 18th pair with each group of colours you ll untie this slip knot as soon as you begin knitting with those colours refer to the cuff chart at the end of the pattern for the rest of this section turn to work the other way this will be your first row and you ll need to use intarsia twists to link the colour groups together remember that the first twist of the row is more involved than the second and third which are just normal twists before you make your first stitch bring the yarns for the third colour group to meet the yarns for the first colour group and do your first intarsia twist you don t have to undo the slip knot for the third colour group quite yet for the cuff the last pair of stitches in each colour block will be slipped rather than worked into slip the first stitch purlwise
